item.title: Project Natal
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“ak226688, post:30, topic:282681”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=373550.msg2819998#msg2819998 date=1244528849]

what is so entrancing about an eyetoy on steroids?

The fact it’s stepping away from the controller. Why are you so against it? You’re not stating anything bad about it. You’re just saying it’s shit but not giving any reasons why. I think you’re just biased against Microsoft.

a) sony have had this technology for ages, b) if i wanted to start jumping around to play games i’d go outside and actually do them instead of simulating them c) its going to unreliable as anything that moves within its field of vision will cause the game to do things you dont want it to so if you have a dog or a cat and they wander in shot the game will start doing things you didnt plan on doing. And yes i am extremely biased against microsoft they are a company with no respect for customers and even less respect for their products
[/quote]are you one of them fagy ps3 fanboys? microsoft ownz best company ever[/quote]
I favour Microsoft, but they should at least attempt to perfect their products before relesing.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Natal
item.dc:creator: @0bbyme 0bbyme
item.description:
@0bbyme wrote:

well this camera is not like the other ones, although its not a original plan. this camera is much more high tech then the old eye toy and crap. If you saw e3 then you would be able to see that.

[code]LOS ANGELES — A planned camera controller for Xbox 360 promises 3-D motion recognition that will turn your entire body into a game controller.

Code-named Project Natal, the camera controller will sit beneath your television set and be capable of translating every movement of your body into a game control, Microsoft said Monday as it unveiled the system during its press briefing at the Electronic Entertainment Expo.
[/code]

[code]Natal will let gamers browse the Xbox 360 menus and watch movies, and could help make interactive entertainment as “approachable” as other forms of entertainment, according to Hollywood legend Steven Spielberg, who took the stage during Microsoft’s presentation to praise Project Natal.

[/code]

[code]It’s an interesting and unexpected move by Microsoft, which already has captured hard-core gamers with its consoles and is now looking to attract a wider audience by cranking out casual games and turning the Xbox 360 and the Xbox Live digital media deliver service into an entertainment hub. While rumors of a motion controller similar to the Wii’s have been making the rounds, Microsoft said it is simply moving beyond the need for any handheld controller.

[/code]

AND FINALLY THE BEST PART OF IT

Top designers like Fable II’s Peter Molyneux are currently working on software to use with the hardware

now are your choiced the same?

Read full topic
